availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William King Maupin, Jr. (Madison County, KY, farmer and soldier (C.S.A.))

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, soldier. Madison County, Kentucky, native. Son of King Maupin and Nancy Maupin. Resident of Madison County in 1850. Farmer in Madison County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as private and sergeant from August 1862 to January 1865. Held as prisoner of war at Camp Chase and Camp Douglass from July 20, 1863 to January 12, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 1, pp. 228B-229A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 1, p. 389
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 41.
